pull_request.title: [Blueprint] Add support for moving and rotating models

update.description:
depends on [ign-rendering pull request #165](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/165/ogre2-support-mouse-picking-for-objects/diff)

Added a new `transform_control` gui system that provides the gui buttons for changing between selection, translation, and rotation modes

Updated Scene3D to handle mouse events for selecting, translating, and moving models

Updated `user_commands` system to provide a service for pose commands.

TODO:

* ~~pass the PoseCmd component to the physics system and set the model pose there~~

content.raw:
I started a prototype on branch `component_inspector`  efc9e4f

![poseproto.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/1006676039-poseproto.gif)

Is this what you had in mind, or were you hoping for something more integrated with the transform tool?

Also, since we're past feature freeze, I'm not sure how much of a priority this is, can it still go in before the release?
content.html:
I started a prototype on branch component_inspector efc9e4f

Is this what you had in mind, or were you hoping for something more integrated with the transform tool?

Also, since we're past feature freeze, I'm not sure how much of a priority this is, can it still go in before the release?

pullrequest.title: [Blueprint] Add support for moving and rotating models

content.raw: The issue happens to every component that is created on demand. I can reproduce the issue with the `diff_drive` world, which creates the `JointVelocityCmd` component, even on the `entity_tree` branch. It's not clear to me yet why components created on demand are having issues, but components created on the server since startup are fine even if the GUI doesn't use them. I'm debugging with my branch.
content.html: The issue happens to every component that is created on demand. I can reproduce the issue with the diff_drive world, which creates the JointVelocityCmd component, even on the entity_tree branch. It's not clear to me yet why components created on demand are having issues, but components created on the server since startup are fine even if the GUI doesn't use them. I'm debugging with my branch.

  • update style sheet / icon colors

pullrequest.title: [Blueprint] Add support for moving and rotating models

content.raw: Yeah, we could do that. I do like the idea of implementing `set_pose` via user_commands so that we can capture the undo behavior down the road. Is that what you're thinking? Also, the `move_entity` feature has functionality for setting model and link velocities which I don't think we are ready to expose to users yet.
content.html: Yeah, we could do that. I do like the idea of implementing set_pose via user_commands so that we can capture the undo behavior down the road. Is that what you're thinking? Also, the move_entity feature has functionality for setting model and link velocities which I don't think we are ready to expose to users yet.
